metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30848 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.8 and iPadOS 14.8, Safari 15, iOS 15 and iPadOS 15. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
